oai_dc:dc.dc:title: United States Quartermaster account to W. B. Dodd and Company

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Account Form No. 12 from the United States Army Quartermaster for the purchase of one iron box for the protection of Quartermaster's funds at a cost of $40.00. Item was received at Eastport, Mississippi, by Captain Simon Perkins Jr., U. S. Army Quartermaster's Office, on June 25, 1862.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Historical Society Civil War Collection, 1860-1982
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay.
